title: Deployment Workflows & CI/CD Intro
overview: Learn deployment best practices, automate deployments, and understand CI/CD pipelines.

sections.title: Deployment Strategies
sections.content:
# Deployment Methods

## 1. Manual Deployment
```bash
ssh server
cd /var/www/app
git pull
npm install
npm run build
pm2 restart app
```
Problems: Error-prone, downtime, not repeatable

## 2. Blue-Green Deployment
- Two identical environments (blue, green)
- Deploy to inactive environment
- Switch traffic instantly
- Rollback is instant

## 3. Rolling Deployment
- Update servers one at a time
- No downtime
- Used with load balancers

## CI/CD Pipeline
```
Code Push → Tests → Build → Deploy
```
Tools: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins

questions.question: What is CI/CD?
questions.explanation: CI/CD automates testing and deployment of code changes.

questions.question: Blue-green deployment benefit?
questions.explanation: Blue-green keeps old version running, allowing instant rollback by switching back.

questions.question: Good deployment practices?
questions.explanation: Automation, testing, and health checks ensure reliable deployments.

questions.question: What is PM2?
questions.explanation: PM2 manages Node.js processes, provides monitoring, and enables zero-downtime restarts.

questions.question: Explain zero-downtime deployment
questions.correctAnswer: Deploying new code without making the service unavailable by using techniques like graceful restarts, blue-green deployment, or load balancer routing
questions.explanation: Zero-downtime keeps service available during deployment through various strategies.

troubleshooting.solution: Use pm2 reload (not restart) or implement health checks
Clear build cache, check PM2 is restarting correct app, verify deployment script
